---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>40 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Submodule.Equiv` `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Submodule.Range` `Mathlib.Algebra.MonoidAlgebra.Degree` `Mathlib.Algebra.MonoidAlgebra.Support` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.BigOperators` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.CancelLeads` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Coeff` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Degree.Definitions` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Degree.Domain` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Degree.Lemmas` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Degree.Monomial` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Degree.Operations` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Degree.SmallDegree` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Degree.Support` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Degree.TrailingDegree` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Degree.Units` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Derivative` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Div` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.EraseLead` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Eval.Coeff` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Eval.Degree` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Eval.Irreducible` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Eval.SMul` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Eval.Subring` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Identities` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Inductions` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Mirror` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Monic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Reverse` `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.UnitTrinomial` `Mathlib.Data.Finsupp.Weight` `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Choose.Vandermonde` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.BilinearMap` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Countable` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Finsupp.LinearCombination` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Finsupp.Supported` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Polynomial.Hermite.Basic` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Polynomial.Opposites` `Mathlib.Tactic.ComputeDegree`</details>|2|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Jacobson.Artinian` (new file)|1605|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Module.finite_iff_isArtinianRing`
`+ Module.finite_iff_krullDimLE_zero`
`+ Module.finite_of_finite_mul_of_field`
`+ Module.finite_of_isArtinianRing`
`+ range_restrictScalars`
`+ restrictScalars_map`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: alreadydone can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I think you can refer to https://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/0CY7 since this result is a strict generalization (Field -> ArtinianRing). Do you have a reference for this exact result? Wikipedia calls 0CY7 [Zariski's lemma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zariski%27s_lemma). I got curious whether Field can be replaced by DivisionRing and found that it's an open problem: see https://mathoverflow.net/questions/324885/infinite-dimensional-finitely-generated-algebraic-division-algebra
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0c1ab567-b04e-4156-8cc8-e5a34a79ba32)

I think that tag goes to `finite_of_finite_type_of_isJacobsonRing`, which is a key ingredient of the proof.

I can't find the proof I am following (it was done 3 years ago), It might be a paraphrase of Atiyah Mccdonald Exercise 8.3 (which says that artinian <=> k-finite for an algebra of finite type over a field k), but the proof doesn't really match the hint. The proof of 6.11 might be the inspiration instead.

This lemma is needed in 1 => 2 of [stacks#00PJ](https://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/00PJ) and in there they pointed directly to Noether normalization for the proof of "artinian => k-finite".

Yeah, the Wikipedia page on Zariski's lemma also says that one proof uses Noether normalization (together with that integral extensions preserve Krull dimension). I don't think the existing proof in mathlib uses it, since Noether normalization hasn't been merged yet ...
@alreadydone Is there anything that you suggest I add?

I suggest adding a reference to Zariski's lemma and stacks#0CY7 at [finite_of_finite_type_of_isJacobsonRing](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Jacobson/Ring.html#finite_of_finite_type_of_isJacobsonRing), not necessarily in this PR.

In [this commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/69a33893e5af81cf631a10154b652db5b6c1697f#diff-6adf2b9b13e4ed13e1e69a2f2e0de9f64952a597413d648204ed9961d26b9e6eL35-R38) I show how to refactor the proof of `IsSemiprimaryRing.isNoetherian_iff_isArtinian` to accommodate the result in this PR. Maybe you and @jcommelin can judge which approach is better.
It seems like your approach gives some stronger result as well? I don't think I would need those results but It's nice to have them anyways.

Perhaps It would be faster if you just open a PR on [your branch](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/artinianJacobson_demo)? But it would also work if you just merge that branch into this PR.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory): artinian rings over jacobson rings
